metadata.title: CVE-2023-37457 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: Asterisk is an open source private branch exchange and telephony toolkit.In Asterisk versions 18.20.0 and prior, 20.5.0 and prior, and 21.0.0; aswell as ceritifed-asterisk 18.9-cert5 and prior, the 'update' functionalityof the PJSIP_HEADER dialplan function can exceed the available buffer spacefor storing the new value of a header. By doing so this can overwritememory or cause a crash. This is not externally exploitable, unlessdialplan is explicitly written to update a header based on data from anoutside source. If the 'update' functionality is not used the vulnerabilitydoes not occur. A patch is available at commita1ca0268254374b515fa5992f01340f7717113fa.

criterions.comment: asterisk package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
